MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The wind blowing from the bottom of the cliff is strong, but it doesn't blur her aim. Pale purple smoke rises from the muzzle of the scorched sniper rifle.
Far below the precipice lays a man who has been shot in the head.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: "I taught you this. I taught you that the back of a target that is trying to run away is easier to aim at than a target that is motionless." (Name: Heroine of the novel)

Lowering her sniper rifle, Nina mutters to herself.
Looking down at the corpse of her former subordinate, she faintly grimaces.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: "No matter what the reason, betrayal is unacceptable. But you know what? Even if everything you said was a lie...I loved you." (Name: Nina)
Nina stands up and unties her hair. Holding her beloved gun, she turns on her heel and walks away, her beautiful blond hair fluttering in the strong wind, as if she's trying to break the sentiment.
St. Iris is crowded on this day off. There seems to be a festival going on in the shopping district, and a fair is being held in the street.
I'm sitting on a bench across from the fountain in the central plaza, reading an action novel I had just bought, when suddenly something presses against my back.
Don't move.

Close the book and raise your hands slowly,
or you'll be looking for a big barrel stopper to plug the hole in your chest.
I do as I'm told, inching my hands up.

I was completely unaware that she was standing behind me.
She's the only one I know of who can completely eliminate all signs of her presence.
...Volgo?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Correct, Conductor.
I apologize for suddenly sticking my index finger in your back.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'm sorry I put on a bad act while you were reading. Actually, I've read that novel because it was recommended by an acquaintance. "Nina of the Borderline". It's definitely a masterpiece.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
By the way, did you notice that that was a reenactment
of the scene at the beginning?

Of course, I noticed right away. I'm quite into the dialogue.
Somehow, she seems to overlap with the heroine, Nina.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Me and Nina? She doesn't sound like much to me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Of course, it's an honor to hear you say that.
Nina is a special heroine that many snipers admire.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: But I am not a lone wolf like her, nor am I a vessel for heroism. If I didn't have a gun, I'd be an ordinary girl who could be found anywhere. Even with novels, I prefer romance stories to these action ones.
Volgo takes out a book and shows it to me.
"My Strong Lover is a Bodyguard - Embrace Me in St. Iris~"

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's my favorite book. I think you'll like it.

What a very accommodating title.
I can pretty much tell what the story is about without reading it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The heroine, Lisa, is a naive and selfish young woman. Her bodyguard, Daniel, is a top-notch martial artist and gunslinger, and although he always looks scary on the job, he has a heart of gold.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: At first, Lisa is repulsed by the idea of having a bodyguard, but she soon finds herself drawn to Daniel's strength and kindness. The two have a heart-to-heart and go on their first date at a festival in St. Iris, just like this, on a sunny afternoon.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
On their date, Lisa's bag is stolen while she's not looking.
Of course, Daniel gets it back, but he has the best lines!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: "Don't take your eyes off what's important. If you regret it after you've lost it forever, it's too late. It's the same with your loved ones. You can't protect them unless they're within your reach, right?"

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: And then he squeezes Lisa's hand. Don't you think that's an enchantingly cool line? I'd love to hear someone say that to me just once.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I-I'm sorry. I got all worked up...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'm sorry you had to hear that crap. I know.
I know I can't be a heroine who needs someone to protect her.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's just... I want to cherish this feeling of longing for the world of romance novels. I wanted you to know that. That's all.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Sorry to interrupt. Go on with your reading.
I'm going to take a little tour of the festivities in the square.
I hurriedly grab Volgo's hand as she tries to leave.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor?
I don't think it's a silly story. I'm glad you shared it with me.

If you don't mind, we could take a look around the festival together.
Let's recreate Daniel and Lisa's date.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Daniel and Lisa...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Okay, if you're okay with it, I would love to have you.
Volgo turns her head shyly and squeezes my hand instead of replying.
